--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@f...> wrote:

> > I see what you mean. However, one of our goals in JUnit 4 was to 
> > remove the
> > recursive composition of tests. It is difficult to explain and 
> > difficult to
> > support properly in test runners. What I need is an example of JUnit 
> > 4-style
> > dynamic test case creation.
> >
> Nothing is coming to mind at the present time.  Let me give this some 
> more thought.  It may be a dead horse.
> 
> BTW: I appreciate your openness to suggestions.

From time to I'm using something like this to verify some conditions:

public static TestSute suite() {
  TestSuite suite = new TestSuite( "Validator");
  for(...) {
    if( condition is invalid) {
      suite.addTest( new FailingTestCase( ..., new
ComparisonFailure(..., expect, actual));
    } else {
      add a regular test to the suite.
    }
  }
  return suite;
}

Such approach allows to see all the errors with the source data in
case if test case can't be created for given data set. For loop can
iterate trough some config file or even trough data in the database.

  regards,
  Eugene
